data.name: Car Debugging: Speedometer
data.description:
Your car measures speed by simply counting how many times the tire (more specifically the axel) makes a full rotation in one second. It is converted to miles per hour by comparing the car's internal rev/mile to what is measured. Here's an example:
```
A tire gets 672 rev/mile.
We measure a speed of 12.13 rev/sec
This is equal to 728 rev/min or 43680 rev/hr
43680 revolutions in an hour divided by 672 miles per revolution gives us: 65 mph
```
Tire revolutions per mile are calculated with a simple formula. First you get the diameter by multiplying the tire circumfrence by pi. Then you divide the total number of inches in a mile (`63,360`) by the circumference, and you have the rev/mile for that tire. The thing about tires is that they use a very specific numbering system that is logical, but not intuitive to most car owners. [See more here](https://tiresize.com/calculator/). If our tire size is: `200-70-R19`, to get the acutal diameter of the tire (not the diameter of the wheel) we need to make the following calculation:
```
(200 * 70 / 2540 * 2) + 19
```
Write a function that returns our current speed in miles per hour as an integer. It should accept two arguments: tire size as a string, and speed measured in revolutions per second as a float. Some example inputs are below:
```
Tire Size: "200-70-R19" rev/sec: 12.13  ->  65

Tire Size: "155-15-R13" rev/sec: 24.80  ->  65

Tire Size: "315-80-R30" rev/sec: 7.35  ->  65

```
